name: places/ChIJfwSkAzdZwokRHGry77c_XFc
formattedAddress: 99 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 99 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: Traveling internationally soon and was stoked to find a place to look for luggage and get some better-than-average passport photos. After waiting outside because they were “at capacity” was let it. I inquired about photos and the staff members said they were *only doing them Monday-Wednesday this holiday season* and chuckled, as it was Thursday. I told him it wasn’t quite so funny because I’d traveled into the city from Brooklyn to get this errand done and waded myself through a sea of seasonal tourists. So, despite explaining that round trip this took me almost 2 hours said he couldn’t help me out. Guess I’ll be getting my luggage (and photos) elsewhere. Lost some business there, for sure. So—beware!

originalText.text: I have visited this Rimowa store on multiple occasions, but unfortunately, my experiences have been consistently underwhelming. On several instances, the packaging of items was substandard. For example, when I purchased a classic carry-on, it wasn’t even provided in a bag. Disappointingly, upon arriving home, I discovered it was missing essential components such as the luggage tag. Additionally, I've noticed that certain products are frequently out of stock. The customer service also leaves much to be desired; the sales associates often seem uninviting, contributing to an unwelcoming atmosphere that suggests both the customers and the staff would rather be elsewhere.

originalText.text:
Went in with my friend as she heard about the passport Photo Booth and wanted to give it a shot. I was curious about their luggages as I’ve always like looking for new luggage as I travel often and I prefer getting good quality so it can last years on end. As my friend walked to the Photo Booth, this salesman popped out of the corner saying we should have told him we were using the booth with a strong attitude. It was extremely off putting because one, isn’t it free? Two, for selling luggage at that price point, you would think their tone would never EVER raise to that level while talking to a potential sale. I guess his SD energy really needed to come out today.

I would encourage anyone to look for luggage’s elsewhere, there are plenty of stores in soho. There is some strong bad energy coming from that staff.

originalText.text: They advertise the free passport pic service, but apparently only does it on certain days of the week. Which is not stated anywhere on their website or store. So it feels like discrimination. If you don't want people to use this service, advertise it as "with purchase only"  don't try to gain good credit by advertising this perk and not actually offer it. The security let me in, then changed his mind and told me to go out and wait on line.. after waiting, he asked if I was here for a passport photo and that they're not doing it. They're definitely not on my list for a new luggage

originalText.text:
I’ve been to Rimowa stores in multiple countries, but this one has the best customer service so far. I’ve got my wheels replaced quickly (Solana I believe was the person who assisted me, she was brilliant).
Also, truly don’t understand people reviewing this store with a 1 star based on the free passport photo service (which is a courtesy anyway).
